Description: Mould-made scarab in glazed composition; back simply marked with main features indicated, clypeus, prothorax and elytra; at side, legs very simplified, indicated by two horizontal grooves; motif on the underside mostly lost, now illegible; split off right across along line of central perforation; glaze lost; pale buff yellow core.
Curator's comments: It was identified as one of the scarabs illustrated by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. 37, no. 12). The underside of this scarab displays a hare with a sun-disc on its back. However, since the base is now missing, it is impossible to know if this corresponds to the Petrie example. Petrie, W. M. F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 12) (?)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.145) (phase 3)
Condition: Poor, very eroded and base damaged
